title: 820-4924 problens
message: Ok so I got an 820-4924 that has a slightly corroded lcd connector and the microphone connector was burned. I have PP3V42 and PPBUS G3H is 12.56V but no green light. There is no corrosion by the SMC or ISL. Could there still be an SMC issue?

title: 820-4924 problens
message:
Check first SYS_ONEWIRE circuit.
Post some voltages there.
Did you try known good DCIN board?

title: 820-4924 problens
message:
SYS_ONEWIRE is at 3.41V.
SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC in 3.42V

I will try another DC IN board.

title: 820-4924 problens
message: When I checked the power rails I have them up to PP5V_S4, which is at 0V.

title: 820-4924 problens
message: oh yeah and the board is drawing 19mA. Tried a different DC In board but nothing changed.

title: 820-4924 problens
message:
"Check first SYS_ONEWIRE circuit."
I was expecting all U7000 voltages...

Reball SMC, corrosion could affected its solders.

title: 820-4924 problens
message: Oh, ok. I'll get all U7000 voltages. I will also reball the SMC

title: 820-4924 problens
message: So the only other voltage for U7000 is ADAPTER_SENSE, Which is at 3.42V.

title: 820-4924 problens
message:
Looks like SYS_ONEWIRE circuit is closed; just missing communication.
Report back after SMC reballed.
If still the same, change it.

I hope you already tried known good Magsafe 2 charger...

title: 820-4924 problens
message: Yeah i am using an Apple Original Magsafe2 purchased from Best Buy.

title: 820-4924 problens
message: Will Report back after SMC reball...

title: 820-4924 problens
message: Reballed SMC and no change. I think I stated before that I do not get a green light but I do get a MagSafe light. I?m still getting PPBUS, PP3V42 and PP5V_S5. I?m missing the two ?X239? rails in the G3H list, But I think one has to do with trackpad not being plugged in. Still not getting PP5V_S4 either

title: 820-4924 problens
message: Replaced SMC, now drawing 26mA vs the 19mA from before

title: 820-4924 problens
message:
"I think I stated before that I do not get a green light but I do get a MagSafe light"
Do you mean amber light present on the Magsafe?
That is fine, why do you want to get green light?
I was supposing you don't get light on Magsafe at all.
Magsafe should switch from green to amber very fast, even no battery connected.

title: 820-4924 problens
message: Yeah, that Is what I meant. I said in my first post No light but I was mistaken. I get a green/orange light.

title: 820-4924 problens
message:
Then ONEWIRE circuit is OK.
What else problem do you have on the board?

title: 820-4924 problens
message: Missing PP5V_S4 and PP3V3_S5

title: 820-4924 problens
message:
You must get 3V3_S5 prior 5V_S4.

"the power rails I have them up to PP5V_S4"
I was supposing 3V3_S5 is present...

Post SMC_PM_G2_EN, PM_BATLOW_L, PM_DSW_PWRGD, PCH_DSWVRMEN, PM_SLP_SUS_L.
Be sure to use original Magsafe 2 85W charger.

title: 820-4924 problens
message: Oh shoot, yeah just realized I am missing an S5 rail, sorry. Of course I wouldn't get PP5V_S4... late night. Will post results shortly

title: 820-4924 problens
message:
Smc_pm_g2_en: 3.40v
pm_batlow_l: 0v
pm_dsw_pwrgd: 0v
pch_dswvrmen: 3.3v
pm_slp_sus_l: 0v

title: 820-4924 problens
message:
Original Magsafe 2 charger 60/85W for sure???

Post U7501 basic voltages; 23, 12, 13, 22, 29, 21.

title: 820-4924 problens
message: I am so sorry I wasted your time on this one. I ignored the basic rule to pay attention to corroded components, or components with gray end caps. I found another forum post where the person had the same problem on an 820-3437 board. The PP3V3_S5 rail was shorted. They measured the coil (L7560) and found that a cap or two was shorted. So I decided to measure the same coil on my board well lo and behold PP3V3_S5 was short, by the same caps. they were C3280 and C3281 respectively, and are located close to the LCD connector. The end caps were gray but didn't look too bad. well once I took them off, the short was gone. Put some replacements from a donor and now we have fan spin and a ? folder. i should have known better since these two caps are tied to the mic connector which burnt up. lesson learned.

title: 820-4924 problens
message:
You've repaired it and learned a lesson too.
It is not waste of time, nor even for me. :)

title: 820-4924 problens
message: So this one is still working but I have no backlight. I have an image and the fuse is not blown. On Q7700 BKL_EN_L is 12.54V

title: 820-4924 problens
message:
Post U770 voltages, 5, 18, 17, 15, 16, 11.
Also check diode mode to ground at both A/K pins of D7710; w/ and w/o LCD connected.

title: 820-4924 problens
message:
D7710:

W/LCD: A= .884V K=1.233V

W/O LCD: A=.887V  K=1.235V

U7700:
Pin 5: 5.144V
Pin 11: 12.38V
Pin 15: 5.142V
Pin 16: 5.142V
Pin 17: 0V
Pin 18: 5.142V

I also observed when measuring L8300  when turning on board it measures 5V here and then after like 10 seconds it drops to 0.

title: 820-4924 problens
message:
In the time you have 5V at pins 28-30/J8300, check if LCD_HPD_CONN and DP_INT_HPD go both high.

"Put some replacements from a donor and now we have fan spin and a ? folder."
Did you get image and backlight that time?
And now nothing at all?

title: 820-4924 problens
message: I'll check those next. At the time I could not tell if I had an image or not, I had to replace the LCD connector on the board due to corroded/missing pins. I for sure have an image though.

title: 820-4924 problens
message: i get 0v on both

title: 820-4924 problens
message: So I timed how long it takes for the 5V to show up on Pins 28-30 on J8300 and it is about 10 seconds before it comes on then stays fr about 10 seconds before dropping to 0. I noticed on the two tests you wanted me to do the millivolt digit on my DMM would dance between 1 and zero at the 10 second mark, then stop.

title: 820-4924 problens
message:
If these lines stay low, PCH cannot recognize LCD.
Try known good compatible LCD assembly.

title: 820-4924 problens
message: Ok, tried two different screens, still no go

title: 820-4924 problens
message:
At least LCD_HPD_CONN should go high (2.5V), when you have 5V at J8300.
If not, bad video cable, or LCD panel.
Could also be a problem with LCD connector, if you already detected corrosion there.
Check all solders and traces...

title: 820-4924 problens
message: Yeah I tried two different panels after plugging them into other boards.  Should the 5V stay on? Or is it supposed to come on, then tuen off? I guess  I could grab a working board and check.

title: 820-4924 problens
message:
5V should come on for few seconds even if not LCD connected.
But it only remains on if PCH detects LCD.
That is only possible if DP_INT_HPD comes on; it requires 5V above mentioned.

title: 820-4924 problens
message: LOL I think I measured it without LCD... I?ll remeasure with LCD

title: 820-4924 problens
message: Ok, so with test LCD 5V is steady on L8300 and I get 3.3V on pin 2 of C8353.

title: 820-4924 problens
message: I'm also getting 51.81V on pin 2 of D7710...

title: 820-4924 problens
message: I fixed it!!!! don't know how I missed it, but the two vias for pin 1 (PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT) were broken. FIlled the one that was barely broken with solder and ran a wire for the other. oh boy what a troll this was. Now all I have to do is wait for new mic connector to come, run a new pad for that and this will be a fully working board.

title: 820-4924 problens
message:
"51.81V on pin 2 of D7710"
That was the sign; broken LED strips circuit...
